content.description: Move past the first two bolts on thin edges/knobs (crux) before the climbing eases a little. Â Fun climbing, similar to the other climbs on this wall.
content.location: This is currently the farthest right route on the cliff, ie the next route right of 'Knobulator'

climbs.name: Rover Take Over
climbs.fa: Grant Hiskes, Errett Allen, Ken Yager, 1988.

content.description: Amazing face climbing on steep knobs and crimps.
content.location: Climbs just left of the obvious orange streak on the left side of the wall.

content.description:
Starts a little up hill, to the right of "Comfortably Numb".

Climb up past 7 bolts to the "Comfortably Numb anchor.

climbs.name: Mystery Route (Konvicts do Koalas)
climbs.fa: John Tuttle and John from Australia

content.description: The bolted line in between Knobnixious and Knobulator. One of the highest quality routes on the entire face, great knob climbing!
content.protection: Five bolts to a two-bolt anchor

content.description: Probably the most challenging route at East Cottage Dome. Stimulating moves. Crux near the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts, a small cam, cold shuts at the top.

content.description: This is a toprope problem below the anchors for Life in the Cretaceous. It follows a crack/seam at the start and then wanders up and left across the face. We all thought it was much harder than 5.8.
content.protection: Toprope after climbing Life in the Cretaceous, or it's an R/X lead.

climbs.name: Life in the Cretaceous
climbs.fa: Bryan Law, Linda Jarit, George Ridgley (Nov '07)

content.description: A "warm-up" climb on the far left side of the wall. It's got some of the most closely spaced bolts you will find in Tuolumne. I must have botched the sequence at the start because it felt much harder than 10a. Thin and steep right off the deck and then it gets easier above.

climbs.name: Knobvious
climbs.fa: Dan and Sue McDevitt, Dave Gardner, 7/90

content.description:
Starts right of "Old Folks Boogie".

Follow killer knobs past seven bolts and a tied off knob to a two bolt anchor.

This is the second climb encountered on the right side of this cliff. It starts at the base of a left leaning dike (Skeletal Remains, 5.10bX).

Follow four bolts to a two bolt anchor.
Bolts guide you up an undulating face with interesting moves (not just knob pulling) to the dike. Somewhat run-out 5.9 climbing past some suspicious crystals takes you to the anchor.
content.protection: All bolted with modern bolts. 60M rope.

content.description:
This is one of the older routes on the wall. The bolts were replaced by the ASCA in 2005.

The climb is near the left side of the wall. Climb past a bulge and then wander up and left to a bolted anchor. A second pitch goes up an easy corner for a bit and then follows a bolt line on the steep face to the right of a rounded arete. The second pitch has a bit of lichen on it, but it's worth doing and the pitches can be linked together if you are careful of rope drag.

Rap with one 70m rope to the anchors atop "Life in the Cretaceous" and then rap to the ground.

The crux is right at the first bolt stemming across the gash with awkward moves up the orange seam/crack. Cool moves on knobs follows to the bulge. A smaller Alien (green or yellow) may protect moves to a bolt under the bulge. Pull a sweet undercling span to a killer jug over the bulge and rock up to the corner and then the anchor.
content.protection:
QD's, small cam optional

5/16" button heads w/ SMC hangers

content.description: This sporty classic climbs steep knobs past five bolts. Starts just left of a thin, right leaning seam.
